00048 option options[] = {
00049   { "help", no_argument, NULL, 'h' },
00050   { }

00052 
00053 void usage(const BuildConfig& config) {
00054   fprintf(stderr,
00055 "usage: ninja [options] target\n"
00056 "\n"
00057 "options:\n"
00058 "  -f FILE  specify input build file [default=build.ninja]\n"
00059 "  -j N     run N jobs in parallel [default=%d]\n"
00060 "  -k N     keep going until N jobs fail [default=1]\n"
00061 "  -n       dry run (don't run commands but pretend they succeeded)\n"
00062 "  -v       show all command lines\n"
00063 "  -C DIR   change to DIR before doing anything else\n"
00064 "\n"
00065 "  -t TOOL  run a subtool.  tools are:\n"
00066 "             browse  browse dependency graph in a web browser\n"
00067 "             graph   output graphviz dot file for targets\n"
00068 "             query   show inputs/outputs for a path\n"
00069 "             targets list targets by their rule or depth in the DAG\n"
00070 "             rules   list all rules\n"
00071 "             clean   clean built files\n",
00072           config.parallelism);
00073 }
00074 
00075 int GuessParallelism() {
00076   int processors = 0;
00077 
00078 #if defined(linux)
00079   processors = get_nprocs();
00080 #elif defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__FreeBSD__)
00081   size_t processors_size = sizeof(processors);
00082   int name[] = {CTL_HW, HW_NCPU};
00083   if (sysctl(name, sizeof(name) / sizeof(int),
00084              &processors, &processors_size,
00085              NULL, 0) < 0) {
00086     processors = 1;
00087   }
00088 #elif defined(WIN32)
00089   SYSTEM_INFO info;
00090   GetSystemInfo(&info);
00091   processors = info.dwNumberOfProcessors;
00092 #endif
00093 
00094   switch (processors) {
00095   case 0:
00096   case 1:
00097     return 2;
00098   case 2:
00099     return 3;
00100   default:
00101     return processors + 2;
00102   }
00103 }

00105 /// An implementation of ManifestParser::FileReader that actually reads
00106 /// the file.
00107 struct RealFileReader : public ManifestParser::FileReader {
00108   bool ReadFile(const string& path, string* content, string* err) {
00109     return ::ReadFile(path, content, err) == 0;
00110   }
00111 };

00113 bool CollectTargetsFromArgs(State* state, int argc, char* argv[],
00114                             vector<Node*>* targets, string* err) {
00115   if (argc == 0) {
00116     *targets = state->RootNodes(err);
00117     if (!err->empty())
00118       return false;
00119   } else {
00120     for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
00121       string path = argv[i];
00122       if (!CanonicalizePath(&path, err))
00123         return false;
00124       Node* node = state->LookupNode(path);
00125       if (node) {
00126         targets->push_back(node);
00127       } else {
00128         *err = "unknown target '" + path + "'";
00129         return false;
00130       }
00131     }
00132   }
00133   return true;
00134 }
00135 
00136 int CmdGraph(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00137   vector<Node*> nodes;
00138   string err;
00139   if (!CollectTargetsFromArgs(state, argc, argv, &nodes, &err)) {
00140     Error("%s", err.c_str());
00141     return 1;
00142   }
00143 
00144   GraphViz graph;
00145   graph.Start();
00146   for (vector<Node*>::const_iterator n = nodes.begin(); n != nodes.end(); ++n)
00147     graph.AddTarget(*n);
00148   graph.Finish();
00149 
00150   return 0;
00151 }
00152 
00153 int CmdQuery(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00154   if (argc == 0) {
00155     Error("expected a target to query");
00156     return 1;
00157   }
00158   for (int i = 0; i < argc; ++i) {
00159     Node* node = state->GetNode(argv[i]);
00160     if (node) {
00161       printf("%s:\n", argv[i]);
00162       if (node->in_edge_) {
00163         printf("  input: %s\n", node->in_edge_->rule_->name_.c_str());
00164         for (vector<Node*>::iterator in = node->in_edge_->inputs_.begin();
00165              in != node->in_edge_->inputs_.end(); ++in) {
00166           printf("    %s\n", (*in)->file_->path_.c_str());
00167         }
00168       }
00169       for (vector<Edge*>::iterator edge = node->out_edges_.begin();
00170            edge != node->out_edges_.end(); ++edge) {
00171         printf("  output: %s\n", (*edge)->rule_->name_.c_str());
00172         for (vector<Node*>::iterator out = (*edge)->outputs_.begin();
00173              out != (*edge)->outputs_.end(); ++out) {
00174           printf("    %s\n", (*out)->file_->path_.c_str());
00175         }
00176       }
00177     } else {
00178       printf("%s unknown\n", argv[i]);
00179       return 1;
00180     }
00181   }
00182   return 0;
00183 }
00184 
00185 int CmdBrowse(State* state, const char* ninja_command,
00186               int argc, char* argv[]) {
00187 #ifndef WIN32
00188   if (argc < 1) {
00189     Error("expected a target to browse");
00190     return 1;
00191   }
00192   RunBrowsePython(state, ninja_command, argv[0]);
00193 #else
00194   Error("browse mode not yet supported on Windows");
00195 #endif
00196   // If we get here, the browse failed.
00197   return 1;
00198 }
00199 
00200 int CmdTargetsList(const vector<Node*>& nodes, int depth, int indent) {
00201   for (vector<Node*>::const_iterator n = nodes.begin();
00202        n != nodes.end();
00203        ++n) {
00204     for (int i = 0; i < indent; ++i)
00205       printf("  ");
00206     const char* target = (*n)->file_->path_.c_str();
00207     if ((*n)->in_edge_) {
00208       printf("%s: %s\n", target, (*n)->in_edge_->rule_->name_.c_str());
00209       if (depth > 1 || depth <= 0)
00210         CmdTargetsList((*n)->in_edge_->inputs_, depth - 1, indent + 1);
00211     } else {
00212       printf("%s\n", target);
00213     }
00214   }
00215   return 0;
00216 }
00217 
00218 int CmdTargetsList(const vector<Node*>& nodes, int depth) {
00219   return CmdTargetsList(nodes, depth, 0);
00220 }
00221 
00222 int CmdTargetsSourceList(State* state) {
00223   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state->edges_.begin();
00224        e != state->edges_.end();
00225        ++e)
00226     for (vector<Node*>::iterator inps = (*e)->inputs_.begin();
00227          inps != (*e)->inputs_.end();
00228          ++inps)
00229       if (!(*inps)->in_edge_)
00230         printf("%s\n", (*inps)->file_->path_.c_str());
00231   return 0;
00232 }
00233 
00234 int CmdTargetsList(State* state, const string& rule_name) {
00235   set<string> rules;
00236   // Gather the outputs.
00237   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state->edges_.begin();
00238        e != state->edges_.end();
00239        ++e)
00240     if ((*e)->rule_->name_ == rule_name)
00241       for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00242            out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00243            ++out_node)
00244         rules.insert((*out_node)->file_->path_);
00245   // Print them.
00246   for (set<string>::const_iterator i = rules.begin();
00247        i != rules.end();
00248        ++i)
00249     printf("%s\n", (*i).c_str());
00250   return 0;
00251 }
00252 
00253 int CmdTargetsList(State* state) {
00254   for (vector<Edge*>::iterator e = state->edges_.begin();
00255        e != state->edges_.end();
00256        ++e)
00257     for (vector<Node*>::iterator out_node = (*e)->outputs_.begin();
00258          out_node != (*e)->outputs_.end();
00259          ++out_node)
00260       printf("%s: %s\n",
00261              (*out_node)->file_->path_.c_str(),
00262              (*e)->rule_->name_.c_str());
00263   return 0;
00264 }
00265 
00266 int CmdTargets(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00267   int depth = 1;
00268   if (argc >= 1) {
00269     string mode = argv[0];
00270     if (mode == "rule") {
00271       string rule;
00272       if (argc > 1)
00273         rule = argv[1];
00274       if (rule.empty())
00275         return CmdTargetsSourceList(state);
00276       else
00277         return CmdTargetsList(state, rule);
00278     } else if (mode == "depth") {
00279       if (argc > 1)
00280         depth = atoi(argv[1]);
00281     } else if (mode == "all") {
00282       return CmdTargetsList(state);
00283     } else {
00284       Error("unknown target tool mode '%s'", mode.c_str());
00285       return 1;
00286     }
00287   }
00288 
00289   string err;
00290   vector<Node*> root_nodes = state->RootNodes(&err);
00291   if (err.empty()) {
00292     return CmdTargetsList(root_nodes, depth);
00293   } else {
00294     Error("%s", err.c_str());
00295     return 1;
00296   }
00297 }
00298 
00299 int CmdRules(State* state, int argc, char* argv[]) {
00300   for (map<string, const Rule*>::iterator i = state->rules_.begin();
00301        i != state->rules_.end();
00302        ++i) {
00303     if (i->second->description_.unparsed_.empty())
00304       printf("%s\n", i->first.c_str());
00305     else
00306       printf("%s: %s\n",
00307              i->first.c_str(),
00308              i->second->description_.unparsed_.c_str());
00309   }
00310   return 0;
00311 }
00312 
00313 int CmdClean(State* state,
00314              int argc,
00315              char* argv[],
00316              const BuildConfig& config) {
00317   Cleaner cleaner(state, config);
00318   if (argc >= 1)
00319   {
00320     string mode = argv[0];
00321     if (mode == "target") {
00322       if (argc >= 2) {
00323         return cleaner.CleanTargets(argc - 1, &argv[1]);
00324       } else {
00325         Error("expected a target to clean");
00326         return 1;
00327       }
00328     } else if (mode == "rule") {
00329       if (argc >= 2) {
00330         return cleaner.CleanRules(argc - 1, &argv[1]);
00331       } else {
00332         Error("expected a rule to clean");
00333         return 1;
00334       }
00335     } else {
00336       return cleaner.CleanTargets(argc, argv);
00337     }
00338   }
00339   else {
00340     return cleaner.CleanAll();
00341   }
00342 }
00343 
00344 }  // anonymous namespace
00345 
00346 int main(int argc, char** argv) {
00347   const char* ninja_command = argv[0];
00348   BuildConfig config;
00349   const char* input_file = "build.ninja";
00350   const char* working_dir = 0;
00351   string tool;
00352 
00353   config.parallelism = GuessParallelism();
00354 
00355   int opt;
00356   while ((opt = getopt_long(argc, argv, "f:hj:k:nt:vC:", options,
00357                             NULL)) != -1) {
00358     switch (opt) {
00359       case 'f':
00360         input_file = optarg;
00361         break;
00362       case 'j':
00363         config.parallelism = atoi(optarg);
00364         break;
00365       case 'k':
00366         // We want to go until N jobs fail, which means we should ignore
00367         // the first N-1 that fail and then stop.
00368         config.swallow_failures = atoi(optarg) - 1;
00369         break;
00370       case 'n':
00371         config.dry_run = true;
00372         break;
00373       case 'v':
00374         config.verbosity = BuildConfig::VERBOSE;
00375         break;
00376       case 't':
00377         tool = optarg;
00378         break;
00379       case 'C':
00380         working_dir = optarg;
00381         break;
00382       case 'h':
00383       default:
00384         usage(config);
00385         return 1;
00386     }
00387   }
00388   argv += optind;
00389   argc -= optind;
00390 
00391   if (working_dir) {
00392 #ifdef _WIN32
00393     if (_chdir(working_dir) < 0) {
00394 #else
00395     if (chdir(working_dir) < 0) {
00396 #endif
00397       Fatal("chdir to '%s' - %s", working_dir, strerror(errno));
00398     }
00399   }
00400 
00401   State state;
00402   RealFileReader file_reader;
00403   ManifestParser parser(&state, &file_reader);
00404   string err;
00405   if (!parser.Load(input_file, &err)) {
00406     Error("loading '%s': %s", input_file, err.c_str());
00407     return 1;
00408   }
00409 
00410   if (!tool.empty()) {
00411     if (tool == "graph")
00412       return CmdGraph(&state, argc, argv);
00413     if (tool == "query")
00414       return CmdQuery(&state, argc, argv);
00415     if (tool == "browse")
00416       return CmdBrowse(&state, ninja_command, argc, argv);
00417     if (tool == "targets")
00418       return CmdTargets(&state, argc, argv);
00419     if (tool == "rules")
00420       return CmdRules(&state, argc, argv);
00421     if (tool == "clean")
00422       return CmdClean(&state, argc, argv, config);
00423     Error("unknown tool '%s'", tool.c_str());
00424   }
00425 
00426   BuildLog build_log;
00427   build_log.SetConfig(&config);
00428   state.build_log_ = &build_log;
00429 
00430   const string build_dir = state.bindings_.LookupVariable("builddir");
00431   const char* kLogPath = ".ninja_log";
00432   string log_path = kLogPath;
00433   if (!build_dir.empty()) {
00434     if (MakeDir(build_dir) < 0 && errno != EEXIST) {
00435       Error("creating build directory %s: %s",
00436             build_dir.c_str(), strerror(errno));
00437       return 1;
00438     }
00439     log_path = build_dir + "/" + kLogPath;
00440   }
00441 
00442   if (!build_log.Load(log_path.c_str(), &err)) {
00443     Error("loading build log %s: %s",
00444           log_path.c_str(), err.c_str());
00445     return 1;
00446   }
00447 
00448   if (!build_log.OpenForWrite(log_path.c_str(), &err)) {
00449     Error("opening build log: %s", err.c_str());
00450     return 1;
00451   }
00452 
00453   vector<Node*> targets;
00454   if (!CollectTargetsFromArgs(&state, argc, argv, &targets, &err)) {
00455     Error("%s", err.c_str());
00456     return 1;
00457   }
00458 
00459   Builder builder(&state, config);
00460   for (size_t i = 0; i < targets.size(); ++i) {
00461     if (!builder.AddTarget(targets[i], &err)) {
00462       if (!err.empty()) {
00463         Error("%s", err.c_str());
00464         return 1;
00465       } else {
00466         // Added a target that is already up-to-date; not really
00467         // an error.
00468       }
00469     }
00470   }
00471 
00472   bool success = builder.Build(&err);
00473   if (!err.empty()) {
00474     printf("build stopped: %s.\n", err.c_str());
00475   }
00476 
00477   return success ? 0 : 1;
00478 }
